title: Automakers invented the crime of jaywalking (2015)
dot: digraph{subgraph cluster_1{label="A hundred years ago";pedestrian->street[label="Walk across freely"];}subgraph cluster_2{label="Today";pedestrian->crosswalk[label="Need to find"];pedestrian->traffic_light[label="Wait for green"];pedestrian->jaywalking[label="Fail to follow = Crime"];}subgraph cluster_3{label="1910 - 1920s";cars->"Pedestrian deaths"[label="Spread widely"];"Pedestrian deaths"->public[label="Outrage"];public->drivers[label="Blame"];}subgraph cluster_4{label="1920 - 1925";anti_car_activists->"Slow cars down"[label="Sought"];"Cincinnati petition"->auto_dealers[label="Terrified"];auto_dealers->"Nationwide action"[label="Galvanized"];"Auto groups"->street[label="Redefine (pedestrians restricted)"];}subgraph cluster_5{label="1920s - 1930s";"Auto industry"->news[label="Shape coverage"];"Auto industry"->"School campaigns"[label="Sponsor"];"Auto industry"->shame[label="Use to enforce laws"];shame->"Jaywalking term"[label="Popularize"];}"Jaywalking term"->"Current situation"[label="Entrenched concept"];}
